statements.name: PROC TREE
statements.description: The TREE procedure produces a tree diagram, also known as a dendrogram or phenogram, from a data set created by the CLUSTER or VARCLUS procedure that contains the results of hierarchical clustering as a tree structure.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a color for the frame, which is the rectangle bounded by the axes.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data set defining the tree.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Reverses the sorting order for the SORT option.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description for the graph in the GOUT= catalog. The default is "Proc Tree Graph Output."

arguments.name: DISSIMILAR
arguments.description: Specifies that the values of the HEIGHT variable are dissimilarities; that is, a large height value means that the clusters are very dissimilar or far apart.

arguments.name: DOCK=
arguments.description: Causes observations in the OUT= data set assigned to output clusters with a frequency of n or less to be given missing values for the output variables CLUSTER and CLUSNAME.

arguments.name: FILLCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character to display between leaves that are not joined into a cluster.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the catalog in which the generated graph is stored. The default is WORK.GSEG.

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies that the AXIS statement used to customize the appearance of the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies certain conventional variables to be used for the height axis of the tree diagram.

arguments.name: HEIGHT
arguments.description: Specifies the _HEIGHT_ variable.

arguments.name: LENGTH
arguments.description: Defines the height of each node as its path length from the root.

arguments.name: MODE
arguments.description: Specifies the _MODE_ variable.

arguments.name: NCL
arguments.description: Specifies the _NCL_ (number of clusters) variable.

arguments.name: RSQ
arguments.description: Specifies the _RSQ_ variable.

arguments.name: HORDISPLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies that the graph be oriented horizontally, with the leaf nodes on the right side, when the HORIZONTAL option is also specified.

arguments.name: HORIZONTAL
arguments.description: Displays the tree diagram with the height axis oriented horizontally.

arguments.name: HPAGES=
arguments.description: Specifies that the original graph be enlarged to cover n1 pages.

arguments.name: INC=
arguments.description: Specifies the increment between tick values on the height axis.

arguments.name: JOINCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character displayed between leaves that are joined into a cluster.

arguments.name: LEAFCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to represent clusters having no children.

arguments.name: LEVEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the level of the tree defining disjoint clusters for the OUT= data set.

arguments.name: LINEPRINTER
arguments.description: Specifies that the tree diagram be displayed using line printer graphics.

arguments.name: LINES=
arguments.description: Specifies the color and the thickness of the lines of the tree, and whether a dot is drawn at each leaf node.

arguments.name: LIST
arguments.description: Lists all the nodes in the tree, displaying the height, parent, and children of each node.

arguments.name: MAXHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum value displayed on the height axis.

arguments.name: MINHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum value displayed on the height axis.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the entry name for the generated graph in the GOUT= catalog.

arguments.name: NCLUSTERS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of clusters desired in the OUT= data set.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the tree.

arguments.name: NTICK=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of tick intervals on the height axis.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set containing one observation for each object in the tree or subtree being processed and variables called CLUSTER and CLUSNAME showing cluster membership at any specified level in the tree.

arguments.name: PAGES=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of pages over which the tree diagram (from root to leaves) is to extend. The default is 1.

arguments.name: POS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of column positions on the height axis.

arguments.name: ROOT=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of the NAME variable for the root of a subtree to be displayed if you do not want to display the entire tree.

arguments.name: SIMILAR
arguments.description: Specifies that the values of the HEIGHT variable represent similarities; that is, a large height value means that the clusters are very similar or close together.

arguments.name: SORT
arguments.description: Sorts the children of each node by the HEIGHT variable, in the order of cluster formation.

arguments.name: SPACES=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of spaces between objects in the output.

arguments.name: TICKPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of column positions per tick interval on the height axis.

arguments.name: TREECHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to represent clusters with children.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies that the AXIS statement be used to customize the appearance of the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VPAGES=
arguments.description: Specifies that the original graph be enlarged to cover n2 pages.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Obtains separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: COPY
statements.description: The COPY statement specifies one or more character or numeric variables to be copied to the OUT= data set.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: The FREQ statement specifies one numeric variable that tells how many clustering observations belong to the cluster.

statements.name: HEIGHT
statements.description: The HEIGHT statement specifies the name of a numeric variable to define the height of each node (cluster) in the tree.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID variable is used to identify the objects (leaves) in the tree on the output. The ID variable can be a character or numeric variable of any length.

statements.name: NAME
statements.description: The NAME statement specifies a character or numeric variable identifying the node represented by each observation.

statements.name: PARENT
statements.description: The PARENT statement specifies a character or numeric variable identifying the node in the tree that is the parent of each observation.
